direction.raw_text: (trying to be casual) Rose, since you're here in bed with me and everything and I've already touched your titty... Can't quite say it; leans over and whispers in her ear and we don't hear what he says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (her eyes open wide as he whispers) Why, Buddy, shut your mouth! What an awful thing to say, and where did you get any such idea as that, anyhow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm curious to see what it's like. I'm very curious, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now that is just too bad! Curiosity killed the cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but satisfaction brought him back. Can I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You ought to be ashamed of yourself astin' such a nasty things a child your age!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't I touch it a little, Rose -- not a lot, just a little?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you can't! I'm... I'm shocked at you, Buddy, real shocked! Now you be quiet or I'm going back to my own bed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Rose. I'm curious, that's all, I have a natural curiosity, it's only human. You're my friend, aren't you? Don't you like me? (again sweetly, almost sugarily) I like you, Rose, a lot -- in fact, I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softens despite herself) Well, you're sweet, but you don't really love me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do. Please, Rose, be a good sport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, you're just a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thirteen. And I have a natural curiosity. It's only nature, Rose, that's all. Now what's wrong with nature, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, nothin'. INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy sitting on the edge of his bed in pajamas. He looks frowzle-haired and glum. The CAMERA FOLLOWS him as he wearily gets up and walks across the bedroom in the moonlight and takes a package of cigarettes from a bureau. Be glances over his shoulder as we hear Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter, hon? Is anything wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, darlin'. Just that damnable insomnia in reverse. I sleep like a baby for an hour then I'm wide awake. You go back to sleep. Daddy lights a cigarette and walks to the window and stares out at the moonlit night. The CAMERA MOVES IN CLOSER on his face and we see a weariness and strain he has not shown before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Depression has got me. That miserable hotel, no money anywhere, strong men out of work, children hungry. It's a great life if you don't weaken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT A shot close on Rose and Buddy in bed. Evidently Rose has weakened and is allowing him to fiddle with her, but we can only surmise this, the shot is on their heads and shoulders and a cloud has crossed the moon, the light is more dim. A different look is on her face, a solemn expression as if she is listening to some far away sound that she finds strangely haunting. She moistens her lips, speaks in a slightly feeble voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better quit that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Rose...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must be outta my mind. Buddy, quit it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I hurting you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pauses, stares off as if listening, then in an even feebler tone, a half whisper) No. No, you're not hurting me. (moistens her lips, swallows) But I think you better quit it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why, if I'm not hurting you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't understand. (puts a hand on his shoulder as if to push him away, but can't; puts her other hand over her eyes) Oh, God, I must be outta my mind. What would your Momma think? The hand falls limply from Rose's eyes and she turns her head to the side and closes her eyes. Helplessly, she lies there as the boy fiddles with her. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy walking down the downstairs hall in a bathrobe and slippers. He looks very frowzled and sleepy. INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - NIGHT ON Daddy as he walks into the kitchen, turns on the light. He goes to the ice box, an old-fashioned type made of wood that takes cakes of ice. Be pours out a glass of milk. INT. HILLYER ROME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a very CLOSE SHOT on Rose's face. The light is dim but we see perspiration on her forehead. Her breathing is not normal. Her eyes are shut tight, her teeth are clenched. CUT TO a shot CLOSE on Buddy. We do not see what he is doing, but evidently he is fiddling with her. He seems quite interested in the proceedings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, beyond a doubt this is the most fascinating experience of my life. INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy in the kitchen as he sits rather gloomily at the kitchen table drinking the glass Of milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) Ehh-hh, Lord, man born of woman hath few days and they are full of trouble. INT. HILLYER HOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot close on Rose ai Buddy in the bed. The shot is of their heads and shoulders. She has an arm very tight around his shoulders and her eyes are shut tight. The moment of truth is at hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohh-hh! Ohhh-hh! (it's all over; she twists sideways, puts both arms around him) Oh, Buddy, you're so sweet. I love you a lot. INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy as he washes out the glass in the sink. INT. HILLYER HOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Rose and Buddy in the bed. The extremity of her crime has dawned on Rose and she is sitting up in the bed with a look of horror on her face. Buddy is staring worriedly at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, are you all right? Are you sick or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (staring off in space, lost in horror) No. No, I'm all right. (turns, stares at him, puts a hand in woe on her forehead) Oh, God, what have I done? I have robbed a cradle and fallen into hell! (fumbles desperately on bed for cigarettes) I must be crazy, a child like you. Oh, God, oh, Lord. This is awful, this is terrible, I gotta get outta here! ANOTHER ANGLE, on Rose and Buddy as Rose in a panic gets out of the bed, pulls down her thin nightgown and tiptoes toward the door. She stops and looks back as a chilling thought occurs to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, you wouldn't tell nobody, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a trifle too piously) Don't worry, Rose, I won't tell a soul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure hope you don't. (still in a panic) I gotta get outta here, good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sweetly) Good night, Rose. INT. HILLYER SOME - UPSTAIRS HALL AND DOWNSTAIRS HALL CUT TO a shot of Daddy walking down the downstairs hall in his bathrobe. The shot is down the staircase and Rose in the upstairs hall tiptoes into the picture. A floorboard creaks and he looks up and sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, what are you doing up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin', just goin' to the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is anything wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, good night. ANOTHER ANGLE on Rose in the upstairs hall. Fortunately for her the light is dim. Her knees are shaking beneath the nightgown, she looks as if she might faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. The CAMERA FOLLOWS her as she goes on shaky legs down the hall. INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Rose as she enters her small bedroom. Feebly, as if totally exhausted, she shuts the door behind her then leans against a bureau and states into its mirror. The horror of her own criminality has overwhelmed her. With trembling hands, she takes a cigarette from her half empty pack and finds a wooden kitchen match on the bureau. Her hands tremble visibly as she strikes the match. She has not turned on the light in her room and her considerable charms are very apparent in the orange glow of the match. Burning match in her fingers, she stares at her own reflection in the bureau mirror, transfixed by a horrible realization. INT. HILLYER HOME - DREAM - CELLAR QUICK DISSOLVE TO BLURRED SCREEN: the border of the screen is blurred, we are obviously seeing a nightmare fantasy. The shot is of an eager, excited, diabolically mischievous Buddy and an astonished, awed DOLL. They are in some far dark recess of the cellar of the house and the scene is furtive, murky, cobwebby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait till you hear what happened! Now you wont believe this, Doll, but Rose came in my room and got in my bed last night... ANOTHER ANGLE on Buddy from below with candlelight giving his child's face a sinister look. Now he has "Dracula" teeth and evil arched eyebrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and she sweated and snorted like a horse and had a horrible fit, her eyebrows were all scrunched up and she groaned like she was eying and foamed at the mouth! INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Rose standing horrified before the mirror. The match is still burning in her fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM/STUDY A shot of Mother in her study, a worried Doll stands before her. The border of the screen is blurred, it is another flash of fantasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, dear, what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother, Buddy says Rose got in his bed last night and he fiddled with her and she snorted and had a fit -- and he says I would too if I was grown-up. Is it true, Mother -- would I sweat and snort and froth at the mouth and have a horrible fit like he says? Mother stares in consternation at Doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT PORCH - NIGHT A shot of Daddy and Rose on the front porch of the house. The scene is murky, dark, gloomy night and the weather is bad. Daddy has his arm rigidly thrust outward as he points down the driveway. A weeping, slumped Rose sadly walks down the steps carrying her cardboard suitcase. Fantasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out! Out, you viper in the grass! Out! Never darken our doorstep, you immoral, terrible girl! INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT BACK to Rose standing before the mirror, sick with horror. A feeble whimper-like groan comes from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohh-hh, ohhh-hh... (match burns her fingers, she shakes it out) Ouch! Oh-hh... ohh... ANOTHER ANGLE on Rose as she turns from the bureau and stares off into space, a very badly frightened girl. Half-crying, she speaks to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll tell 'em for sure, he will. Oh, Lord, what can I do? INT. HILLYER HOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy half asleep in bed. The light of the lamp by his bed goes on and he sleepily opens his eyes. The CAMERA COMES BACK and we see Rose in her nightgown standing by his bedside. She is very pale and tears are on her cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate to turn on this light, you Daddy's awake downstairs, but I have to take the chance. (sits by him on bed) Buddy, please don't tell on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rather coolly) I said I wouldn't. ROSE (her lip trembles) Buddy, I have to ask you, as bad as I've been please have pity on me and don't ruin me by telling them what I did. I know it was bad, it was bad and dumb. But mostly it was dumb, I didn't mean you no harm, I'd never want to hurt a hair on your head and that's the truth. I love you. But they'd think I did, they'd think I was awful, they'd despise me and hate me... Rose bows her head and begins crying into her hands. CUT TO a CLOSE SHOT of Buddy. We hear the soft sound of Rose weeping over the shot. Buddy is affected, his flinty child's heart has been touched, but he is not quite ready to admit it yet. He is struggling with himself, trying to remain "cool" and not show his emotion. He frowns, moistens his lips, swallows. With seeming coolness, very much as in the scene with Doll in which he deprecated Daddy's stand at Thermopylae, he shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't know what you're worried about. It was my idea, I was the one who thought of it, not you. The CAMERA PULLS BACK to include Rose. She is staring at the boy with hopeless despair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand. They'd blame me, not you. And they'd think I was awful, a disgustin' girl, which I am, but Buddy, please don't tell them. Please don't. Ill have to go and I love it here, I love your whole fam'ly, your Daddy, your Mother... (pauses, then makes her final and ultimate plea in a shaking voice as tears run down) Buddy, I know I'm no good, I'm a bad girl but I can't help it, please have pity on me and don't tell! Please don't, please... Too much for Buddy, he loses his "cool." He swallows and blinks as if he might cry, then sits erect in the bed and squares his shoulders and assumes a stern expression Daddy style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very solemnly) Rose, they could stick splinters under my fingernails, and I will never say a word! I will never tell them, because... I love you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sees that he means it, smiles in relief and throws her arms around him) Oh, Buddy, you do love me! I knew you did, knew it all the time... INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy, lying in bed and staring up sleeplessly at the ceiling. Insomnia in reverse has got him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a half whisper to himself) Ehh-hh, Lord... great life if you don't weaken. INT. HILLYER HOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Rose and Buddy. Rose is sitting on the bed beside him and she has dried her tears and got herself in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Ill tell you this. I have learned a lesson tonight. I wasn't gonna run around, but when I start botherin' your Daddy and worse robbin' a cradle, I gotta face the facts of life. (pauses, then with firm resolution) Tomorrow mornin', I'm gonna get myself up and go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a wee mite puzzled) You're going to get yourself up and go out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, Mr. Right is out there somewhere and I'm gonna find him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - DAY A shot of a coolly angry Mother in the kitchen. It is late morning. As she talks the CAMERA PULLS BACK to show a sheepish Buddy standing "on the carpet before her. The other children, Doll and Waski, are seated at the kitchen table having hamburgers for lunch. They are happily smiling with schadenfreude amusement at their brother's discomfiture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother, when I have to wake you up at eleven o'clock in the morning you're either sick or you were up very late last night. (points a finger at him) And you weren't reading Huckleberry Finn. I looked and its not in your room. Now what were you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sheepish) Mother, I have to tell the truth. I wasn't reading Huckleberry Finn, I was reading one of those Little Dirty Comic Books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sadly) Oh, Brother, I am so disappointed in you. You mustn't look at those horrible things, they degrade the human image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hangs head) They're filthy, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sex isn't ugly, sex is one of the most beautiful things in life, the creative power of the universe is behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we must respect that power, we must be in awe of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am in awe of it, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you are sufficiently in awe of it. Get the castor oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (winces, as Doll and Waski happily smile) Oh, Mother, not the castor oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't punishment, I don't believe in punishment. It's for your health. Obviously you're sick if you can act like that. As she talks, Buddy reluctantly gets a bottle of castor oil and a tablespoon from a shelf and brings it to her. A smiling Doll comes forward and hands Buddy half of an orange. He makes a face at her. Mother takes the bottle and pours out a tablespoon of castor oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wanly) Mother, cant you make it calomel instead of castor oil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for your own good. When you look at negative, destructive things like those little filthy comic books, you are sick. Here, take this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he is resigned, there's no way out; he makes a face, swallows the castor oil) Geccch, yehh, guhhhh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop gagging like that and putting on a show, and swallow it. BUDDY Uhhh, gahdam stuff! MOTHER What did you say, Brother? BUDDY I said ahhh-dam stuff. MOTHER No, you didn't say that, Brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I did, mother. Your hearing aid isn't working right. I said ahhh-dam stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mother, he's lying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Doll. I'll cut your guts
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (happily excited, stammering) He did lie, and... and... and Mother, yesterday he stole money out of your pocketbook!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet, you little muddy-eyed brat, or Ill kill you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children, children! Be quiet, all of you! (the children at once simmer down) The vibrations in this house are strange today. Where's Rose, anyhow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's getting herself up to go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frowns, adjusts hearing aid) What'd you say, Brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's getting herself up to go out. I think she's coming down the hall now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, it's Thursday. (glances around at sound of an opening door) Hello, Rose, dear... (her eyes open wide as she stares at Rose, disconcerted; now weakly) ... my, you're... looking pretty... CUT TO a shot of Rose in the doorway of the kitchen. She is quite an apparition. She wears bright red lipstick, pink rouge on her cheeks, mascara and her hair is coiffed up in some outlandish manner, but her clothes are the most remarkable thing of all. The skirt is of strange, pink, semi-shiny and very thin material and has about a dozen tiny little flowers that could be rosebuds sewed on it. It fits extremely snugly to say the least. The blouse seems a composite: it has frilly white sleeves that are opaque and otherwise is made of filmy white material that is hardly opaque at all. She has no bra and her breasts are half visible, the nipples denting the material. It is pretty wild for 1935. She seems to have on no underwear of any kind; the skirt, which clings to her like a bathing suit, shows no panty seams. She is carrying a shiny black patent leather pocketbook and has on high heel black patent leather shoes and no stockings. An ingenuous little smile is on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you like my outfit? I made most of it myself. Rose walks in, "modeling" the outfit and the CAMERA PICKS UP Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling, slightly aghast) Well, it's... very gay. We hear the SOUND of the Model A on the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here comes Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (staring down admiringly at the outfit) I have a knack for designing clothes. But I had to buy the shoes and the pocketbook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (makes up her mind to defend Rose) Well, I think it's charming, Rose. (tactfully) But don't you think... ah, the skirt is a little tight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, that's the style. It's meant to be clinging. We hear the PORCH DOOR SLAM. Smiling, happy, Rose glances around. We hear the SOUND of the kitchen door opening. CUT TO a POV SHOT of Daddy in the kitchen doorway. As usual, he has a rolled-up Glenville Tribune in his hand and a Straw hat on the back of his head.His hands are on his hips and he is hunched forward as if he cannot believe what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ye gods and little fishes. What have you done to yourself, Rose? ON THEM ALL. Rose is smiling, happy to be the center of attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin'. I got myself up, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got yourself up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I'm goin' out. Daddy walks slowly into the kitchen shaking his head. Sits at table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um-hmm. Well, that is the damndest outfit I ever saw in my life. You walk down the street like that and they'll put you in jail, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, they won't either. She looks pretty. And I wish you wouldn't pick on the poor girl all the time. Don't listen to him, Rose, you look pretty, even beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles affectionately at Mother) You're so sweet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you've got time before you go "out," get me a half-a-cup of coffee, Rose. Not a whole cup, a half-a-cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, sure, always got time to get you a half-a-cup, and one of these days I'm gonna get you a whole cup and see what happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a growl, doesn't like jokes about his foibles) Um-hmmuhh. I never drink a whole cup, my nerves can't stand the caffeine. Ehh-hh, Lord awful insomnia in reverse last night. Lay there and sweated blood for hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sweetly) Daddy, Buddy was up late last night reading little dirty comic books. Mother gave him a dose of castor oil and he cursed it, he took the Lords name in vain, then claimed he hadn't said it. He lied, Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mustn't be a tattletale, dear. You mustn't be Delilah-ish and Jezebel-ish toward your brother, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only trying to help him, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heh, what a hypocrite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Daddy) I do wish you'd speak to Brother. It's true he's been looking at those horrible little books again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stares sternly at Buddy) Lay off of that stuff, son. It upsets your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (genuinely worried) I'm serious. We forget he's just a child. I wish you'd speak to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take him with me downtown. (glances at Rose as she comes with coffee) And you, too, Rose, if you want a ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, love one. Here's your half-a cup of coffee. Daddy is staring with a very dubious frown at Rose's skirt. He slowly shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a pretty stylish skirt, Rose. The only thing I don't understand is how did you ever get it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (happy, pleased by his interest) Well, it has buttons. Points to little buttons on right side of the skirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can the buttons stand the pressure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are more on the other side. Points to buttons on left side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn around, darlin'. Happy to oblige, Rose turns around. Her plump, round, feminine behind is only too plainly revealed through the thin material. Daddy slowly shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll put her in jail. The damn little fool might as well be naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a wee mite worried) Well, it is a little tight. But it isn't as bad as all that. No one will notice unless they have such thoughts in the first place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who doesn't have such thoughts? (glances at wristwatch) We'd better get going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not having lunch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just half-a-cup of coffee. I never eat, darlin', you know that. Not eating and reverse insomnia are my curses. Let's go, Rose, you and Brother, let's hit the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, you and Brother wait in the car. I want to speak for a moment Lo Mr. Hillyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doll, you and Waski run on, too. EXT. HILLYER HOME - PATIO - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose and Buddy as they walk out onto the patio of the house. Rose walks down the steps to the flower garden and Buddy follows. ANOTHER ANGLE on Rose and Buddy as Rose picks a red rose and puts it in her hair.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did your Momma really give you castor oil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (puts an arm around his shoulders) You're my sweetheart. INT. HILLYER HOME KITCHEN - DAY CUT TO Mother and Daddy at the kitchen table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (earnestly) I wish you wouldn't pick on Rose and tease her like that. Of course her clothes are silly, but she's ignorant, naive, she doesn't know any better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl worries me. If she walks down the street like that, an army will be following her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I admit that outfit isn't very modest. But she doesn't mean any harm, she just wants to attract, attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She will succeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you understand her. It isn't sex she wants, it's love she wants and this is the only way she knows how to get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (musingly) That farmer in Gadsden was awful eager to get rid of her, and I'm beginning to see why.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and his wife both said she had a fine moral character and was wonderful with children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she loves children, all right. (adds dryly) She loves everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's a wonderful quality, not a bad quality. (takes his hand) Have a little patience with her. She's such a good-hearted little thing and tries so hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stares pensively at her) You are the one who's good-hearted. (rises) As for Rose, let's hope for the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rises, again takes his hand) Be kind to her. She loves you so much. (Daddy stiffens slightly, and she adds) In a perfectly proper way, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course. EXT. HILLYER HOME - DRIVEWAY - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose and Buddy waiting in a Model A. Rose is smiling, happy to be going out. The red rose is prominent in her hair, Daddy walks INTO THE SHOT, gets into the driver's seat of the car, He glances in a wry manner at the flower in her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you got in your hair, girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My rose. It's kind of like a motto. People will say, there comes Rose with her rose. Daddy gives her another wry stare and starts the Model A. CUT TO a shot of the Model A going down the driveway. EXT. MODEL A IN TOWN - DAY ANOTHER SHOT or two of the Model A on the quiet summer streets of a sleepy little town in the Depression South of years ago. INT./EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy, Rose and Buddy in the car. Buddy is in the middle. Daddy is staring expressionlessly straight ahead. His tone is sternly neutral as he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were up late last night, Brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reading dirty comic bocks. (glances shrewdly at him) And you admitted it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a trifle uncomfortable) Well, yeah. Both Rose and Buddy begin to look increasingly tense. Hawkshaw the Detective is on the scent. Daddy stares ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were up late last night, too, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (meekly) Yes, sir. I had to go to the bathroom. A long pause, as Daddy stares ahead. His expression is inscrutable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finally, "casually") Sometimes I think I was born to be a detective. I get a feeling about things. I'm not always right, but often I am. EXT. MODEL A BY LIGHT - DAY CUT TO a shot of the Model A as it stops for a red light. INT./EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy, Rose and Buddy in the car. Daddy turns and stares sternly at Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son, was Rose in your room last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (scared, but a good liar) No. Why should Rose be in my room? Daddy sternly scans them both. They stare back "innocently" at him. Finally he seems to accept it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't imagine why. It was just a thought. Daddy shifts gears and faces front. Buddy glances upward in relief, as if to say, "Wow, that was close."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you want me to let you out, Rose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, anywhere downtown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know where you're going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'll just mosey around here and there. EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a shot of the Model A as it stops off the main street of a small sleepy Southern town. INT./EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a shot through the side window on Rose, Buddy and Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this ill right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll do just fine. (gets out of car) Bye-bye, see you later. Rose waves goodbye and walks off down the sidewalk, swinging her hips and her pocketbook, INT./EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a front shot of Daddy and Buddy in the car as they stare after Rose. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of POV Daddy and Buddy of Rose walking along. MUSIC. INT./EXT. MODEL A CUT TO Daddy and Buddy. Daddy slowly shakes his head, shifts gears.. EXT. MODEL A - DAY CUT TO a shot of the Model A as it rolls along the main street. EXT. MODEL A - DAY ANOTHER SHOT of the Model A as it abruptly turns a corner. EXT. MODEL A - DAY ON the Model A as it abruptly turns around corner. Evidently it is circling the block. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose as she walks along, swinging her hips and her pocketbook and smiling at whoever she sees. She passes a few people and she smiles cheerfully at them -- the men stare with a flat interest at her and the women frown, but she smiles at one and all. EXT. MODEL A CUT TO a shot of the Model A as it creeps along. INT./EXT. MODEL A - DAY On Daddy and Buddy in the car. DADDY They might arrest her. I doubt it, but they might. EXT. STREET - BUS STOP - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose as she walks up to a bus stop. A fairly WELL-DRESSED MAN with a door-to-door salesman kit is standing there. Rose glances at him then sidles up alongside him as if she's waiting for a bus. He glances at her for a moment with interest, but doesn't want to stare, looks away. We see the Model A stop in the background of the SHOT. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy and Buddy in the car, watching Rose. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose and the Young Salesman. Rose glances at the man, glances at him again, then sighs and speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My feet sure do hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns to her with a slow smile) Oh, yeah? EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy and Buddy in the car, watching. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a LONG POV SHOT of Rose and the Young Salesman. They are talking amiably. Both are smiling. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy and Buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has made contact. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO ANOTHER POV SHOT of Rose and the Young Salesman. It is another LONG SHOT. MUSIC ON TRACK. They are smiling, talking. The Young Salesman seems to ask Rose a question. She nods and takes his arm and they walk off. EXT. STREET - DAY CUT TO Daddy and Buddy. Daddy is staring pensively at the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw anything like it. How did she pick him up so fast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl strikes like a cobra. Slowly shaking his head, Daddy starts the car. EXT. STREET - DAY A shot of Rose and the Young Salesman as they walk along. She is holding his arm and they are smiling and talking as if the best of friends. We hear MUSIC ON THE TRACK. The MUSIC continues over the following MONTAGE OF SHOTS. INT. HONKY TONK - VARIOUS SHOTS ON Rose in a beer "honky tonk" with the Young Salesman in a booth. He is drinking beer, she is drinking Coca Cola from a bottle. ON Rose in the booth, ANOTHER ANGLE. A second man has joined them, a big beefy man -- he is BUSTER. EXT. STREET - LATE AFTERNOON ON Rose as she walks down a sidewalk in late afternoon with Buster and still another man, a tall fellow in a Coca-Cola Delivery Man's uniform or shirt. Rose seems to be innocently happy, but the men appear to be having a mild dispute. ON Rose getting into Busters car as Buster holds the door for her, smiling. The COCA-COLA DELIVERY MAN is left on the sidewalk, disappointed. INT./EXT. BUSTER'S CAR - DUSK CUT TO a shot of Rose in the car eating barbecue with Buster. She is talking animatedly and he seems enchanted with her. It is dusk. EXT. HILLYER HOME - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of a car pulling up in the driveway of the Hillyer house. Rose gets out, waves goodbye to Buster. It is night. End MUSIC. INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy in pajamas peering out of the bedroom window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quarter of twelve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see any bruises or broken bones. CUT TO a shot of Mother in bed in the four poster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bruises and broken bones, what kind of thing is that to say? Daddy walks INTO THE SHOT, sits on the edge of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why shouldn't she go out and have boyfriends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reason at all, darlin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I wish you'd stop criticizing and picking on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive my crudity, darlin'. All I'm saying is that a girl who would wear clothes like that is going to get in trouble sooner or later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (doubtfully) Well, time will tell, won't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, darlin', time will tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HILLYER HOME - PATIO - DAY A SHOT of Mother on the patio studying. It is a sunny afternoon. Mother looks up idly, looks back down at her notebook, then looks up again with a frown. CUT TO A POV SHOT of a SCRUFFY-LOOKING KAN as he darts behind one tree to another. The Scruffy-looking Man does not seem sinister, but he definitely is scruffy. ON Mother. Frowning, she puts down her notebook and rises, walks toward the door of the kitchen. INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - DAY CUT TO a shot of Rose washing dishes in the kitchen. As usual, she is in a cheerful good humor. We see Buddy at the kitchen table building a model airplane. Mother comes INTO THE SHOT, worried, frowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, that scruffy-looking man is out in the yard again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (her smile fades) Mrs. Hillyer, I don't know who he is, I really don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had better call Daddy. INT. HOTEL - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy behind the desk of a slightly run-down small hotel of the Depression era. He is handing a key to a guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad to have you with us, Mr. Watson. Make yourself at home. Shadrach, take Mr. Watson's bag. A black bellboy takes the guest's bag as Daddy turns to answer a BUZZING switchboard. INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - DAY CUT TO a shot of Mother talking on a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, honey? That scruffy-looking man is out in the yard again. INT. HOTEL - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy at the switchboard. Be is grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luckily, Johnson just walked in to relieve me. I'll be right out there! INT. HILLYER HOME - KITCHEN - DAY CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Rose in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, you must know who the fellow is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (innocently) Well, he might be that man who followed me home from the store the other day. But I don't know who he is, Buddy, I really don't. EXT. HILLYER HOME - YARD CUT TO a shot of the Scruffy-looking Man. Be is half-crouched behind a big oak, peering at the Hillyer house. We hear the approach of a car and the man looks over his shoulder. CUT TO a shot of Daddy in the Model A. The TIRES SCREECH as he puts on the brakes. CUT TO a shot of the Scruffy-looking Man as he turns and runs. On Daddy as he jumps out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back here, sir! Come back here, you! Daddy runs after the man. CUT TO a shot of Daddy running after him. CUT TO A FINAL SHOT of the Scruffy-looking Man as he leaps a hedge in full stride. EXT. HILLYER HOUSE - FRONT PORCH CUT TO a shot of a worried-looking Mother on the front porch of the house. Buddy and a meek-looking Rose are in the background in the doorway. A weary, out-of-breath Daddy comes INTO THE SHOT and walks up the steps, straw hat in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't catch him. He ran like a deer. Daddy fixes a stern glance on Rose. As he does so, Mother and Buddy also turn and look at her. Rose smiles wanly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - DAY A SHOT of Mrs. Hillyer in her bedroom study. She is drinking a Coca-Cola and smoking a cigarette held by a bobbie pin. We hear the SOUND of an old-fashioned doorbell. She ignores it. EXT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT PORCH - DAY CUT TO a shot of a sullen-looking young boy on the front porch. He is poorly dressed. He rings the doorbell. This is BILLY. INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - DAY CUT TO a shot of Mother. Frowning, she gets up. EXT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT PORCH ON Mother as she opens the front door. A sullen Billy stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Rose here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She must have gone out for a walk with the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sullenly) Well, I got to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She isn't here. And I'm sorry, but Mr. Hillyer doesn't want her to have callers during working hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sullenly) Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said she isn't here. NOW you go home. Be a nice boy and go home. Gently but firmly, Mother shuts the door in Billy's face. A SHOT of Billy frustrated on the front porch. Sadly, reluctantly, he turns and walks off the porch down the steps. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - DAY ON mother, peering worriedly through the curtains of the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - DINING ROOM - NIGHT A SHOT of the family at dinner at night. Daddy, Mother, Rose, Buddy, Doll and Waski. The SHOT FAVORS Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sulky boy was here again this afternoon. I was almost scared, he wouldn't go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (throws his napkin on table) Rose, my patience is wearing thin. First a scruffy man who runs like a deer and now a sulky boy who wont go away. This is getting to be a regular monkey and dog show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God I don't know who in the world he is. Really, I don't, I don't know no boy like that, I don't. Slowly, his face grim, Daddy returns his napkin to his lap and resumes eating. The children are very silent and look a trifle scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (finally, in a small voice) Well, it isn't Rose's fault boys and men like her. You cant blame her for that, hon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, I realize you don't know this boy, but if you know anybody who does know him, if you have even a faint clue as to who he might be, then convey to him that he had better stay away from my house and stop scaring my wife... and I don't mean maybe. INT. HILLYER SOME - BUDDY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy in his room at night. He is dressed and at a study table listening with cheap earphones to a homemade crystal radio set. Enter a rather somber-faced Doll in her nightgown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (listening) Chattanooga. I had St. Louis, Missouri.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy, I'm worried about Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So am I.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't got any sense. In some ways, she's awful dumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes off earphones, gives it a moment of grave consideration, then his opinion) It isn't that she hasn't got any sense, Doll. Her basic intelligence is probably above average, maybe quite a bit above average.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why does she act so dumb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dumbness doesn't concern her, Doll. And neither does smartness. You see
direction.name: direction

result.heading: UPSTAIRS HALL AND DOWNSTAIRS HALL CUT TO
CELLAR QUICK DISSOLVE TO BLURRED SCREEN

direction.raw_text: Buddy is interrupted by the SOUND of the distant angry shout of a man's voice, evidently from somewhere outside in the woods because Buddy and Doll turn at once toward the window. In shock they listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch, what are you doing here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to ask you the same question, you bastard!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you to stay away from her, goddamn you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got no right to tell me to stay away from her, I knew her before you did!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, boy. Oh, boy, oh boy. Daddy isn't going to like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She told you to leave her alone, didn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like hell she did! You're the one she wants to get shed of!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! He and Doll hurry from the room. INT. HILLYER HOME - UPSTAIRS HALL AND STAIRS - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Doll running down the upstairs hall and down the stairs. The CAM M FOLLOWS them down the stairs. INT. HILLYER HOME - BACK HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Doll as they slow down and creep cautiously down the back hall to the back porch. We hear the men yelling somewhere out in the dark bushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll swallow teeth yourself if you don't leave her alone, you ugly bastard! Go on, throw one, throw one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll throw one, you son of a bitch! We hear a great CRASHING in the bushes, a SMACK of a fist, a GROAN of shock, an OATH, a SHOUT, more CRASHING. EXT. BACK PORCH - NIGHT CUT TO a shot from the POV of the children, on Daddy on the back porch as the lights blaze on. He wears his bathrobe and has a big shotgun in his hands. Now he speaks in a loud, clear and very angry voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I have got a Parker shotgun here and it is loaded and the trigger is cocked and wherever you birds are and whatever you are doing you had better get the hell out of here goddamned quick! A sudden total silence ensues, then a sudden CRASHING in the bushes as the "birds" take off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do not come back, you sons of bitches! Stay away from my house and home and my wife and children or I'll blow your goddamned heads off! INT. HILLYER HOME - BACK HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Doll as they cower in awe in the downstairs hall. Daddy walks up to them carrying the shotgun. He is grim and furious, but his voice is surprisingly calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You children go to bed. And Brother, stay away from Rose, I'll speak to her in the morning. INT. HILLYER HOME - UPSTAIRS HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Doll in the upstairs hall. Doll meekly goes to her room. Buddy hesitates, looks at Rose's door, glances nervously back at the stairs, then goes to Rose's door, knocks softly, opens it. INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Rose as he stands in the doorway of her room. Rose is sitting on the edge of her bed in her nightgown, a damp cloth held against her jaw which seems a little swollen. A look of fear and guilt is on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rather feebly, as if it explains something) I got an awful toothache.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Rose, if you don't keep your boyfriends away from the house, Daddy is going to fire you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (innocently) But I don't know who they are. Buddy makes an exasperated grimace and exits, shutting door. The CAMERA REMAINS on Rose as she rolls her eyes upward in dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - DINING ROOM - DAY A shot of the family at breakfast in the dining room. The silence is deafening. Everyone looks depressed except Daddy, who is aloofly calm. Rose's head is bowed meekly over her plate as we hear the CLATTER of silverware. Finally, Daddy speaks in an almost pleasant tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Rose, my sleep was a little disturbed last night, and so was Mrs. Hillyer's, and so was the children's. How about you? Was your sleep disturbed, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (solemnly) Yes, Mr. Hillyer, it was. I... I heard strange voices in the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly strumming fingers, finally) Strange voices, Rose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (innocent as an angel) Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still aloofly polite) Now Rose, stop behaving as if you're Bo Peep. Those men had a flight last night because of some female in this house, and it wasn't Dolly or Mrs. Hillyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very tense) I don't think we ought to discuss this in front of the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weeping, a hand over her eyes) Oh... oh... oh! I think... maybe... one of 'em... was Foster... but I don't hardly know him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shut up, Rose. Shut your mouth and quit crying!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (draws herself up) I will not sit here and listen to you be brutal to this poor girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not being brutal to her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You certainly are! She has an awful toothache, look at her jaw, it's all swollen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying to restrain himself, aloofly polite to the utmost) Darlin', it is not my fault if the girl has epizootics -- -- The word means "an animal epidemic," and it's a pet word of Daddy's; he pronounces it epi-zoo-tics, not epi-zoo-ot tics, and uses it to mean any outrageous human malady -- DADDY (CONT'D) -- I am not responsible for her epizootics and I did not bring about her epizootics. Now listen to me. When I have to get up in the middle of the night and defend my home with a shotgun against a couple of damned scoundrels fistfighting in the bushes -- MOTHER Scoundrels? They weren't scoundrels, they were just boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boys? You say to me boys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes, I say that to you, they were boys! Boy friends of Rose, chat's what they were, and why shouldn't she have boy friends? Do you want her to be unnatural? Don't you think she's human the same way you are yourself? It's the South, that's what it is, the South with its horrible traditions, of slavery and crime and the oppression of women, who are just as good as men and just as human!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (his eyes are a trifle glazed) Now darlin', what has the South got to do with this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a real snit, afraid he will fire Rose) And when I try to talk to you seriously, when I try to explain to you the unlimited creative power of life, how beautiful it would be if we gave up this hopeless struggle and simply loved each other from our hearts, what do you do -- you mock me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mildly, his eyes are even more glazed) I don't intend to mock you, dear. I respect your philosophy. It's beyond my comprehension, but I respect it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (head bowed, weeping in a little handkerchief) Ohhh-hh, ohhh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (exasperated) Oh, shut up, Rose, eat your cornflakes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (piteously) I'm not hungry. The word is hongry, not hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you listen to me, Rose -- MOTHER (with fire in her eyes) Just a moment! You are not going to fire this girl for an innocent thing like having boy friends, not while there is breath in my body!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't intend to fire her, darlin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't her fault if she's popular... what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I don't intend to fire her. I just want to ask her to keep her boy friends away from my home and hearth, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (simmers down at once, now calmly) Well, that's very reasonable. Howe I hate to bring it up, but she's got an awful toothache, we've got to carry her to the dentist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to go to the dentist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quiet, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darlin', I'll take a taxi to the hotel. You and Brother can handle the girl's epizootics. I'll just say one more thing. (turns to Rose and, in a grave tone) Rose, I told you you had a friend in Mrs. Hillyer, didn't I, that she would fight for you like a tiger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (meekly) Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, thanks to her, and thanks to this case of epizootics, you are getting another chance. (points a finger at her, and sternly) But don't try my patience again. We have growing children in this house. Do you understand me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. INT. DENTIST'S WAITING ROOM - DAY CUT TO a shot of Mother, Rose and Buddy in a dentist's waiting room. Rose is holding a rubber ice bag to her jaw, which is quite swollen. She is groaning and half weeping in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor thing. Does the ice help, Rose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohh-hh, a little. Oh-h, I ain't never been to no dentist before. He's gonna kill me, I just know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Rose, he'll help you. ANOTHER ANGLE, Rose shrinks in fear as, enter the dentist in a white coat, DR. WINTON, a kindly-looking, gray-haired man. We see a nurse behind him. He smiles in a reassuring manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse says we have a nervous patient. Now, young lady, be calm. First of all, let me tell you, I am not going to hurt you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I am not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you can't kid me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rises, takes her by the hand) Now, come on, Rose. Stop being so childish, come on. INT. DENTIST'S OFFICE - DAY ANOTHER ANGLE, on Rose and Mother and Dr. Winton, as they guide and lead Rose into the dentist's operating room.- She plants her feet and her eyes open wide with horror as she sees the chair and other equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not goin' in there, I don't like the looks of it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed) Rose, sit down in that chair and be quiet! We're trying to help you, you silly creature, sit in that chair!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very reluctantly sits in chair) Oh-hh, ohh-hh, Lord, he's gonna kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and the boy wait outside. INT. DENTIST'S WAITING ROOM - DAY CUT TO a shot of Mother and Buddy in the waiting room. Enter Dr. Winton with a little frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she finally let me look in her mouth. Is it true she's never been to a dentist?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was raised on a poor dirt farm. I'm sure she's never seen a dentist or hardly even a doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she has one mouth in ten thousand, I don't see teeth like that once in ten years. Her trouble is an impacted wisdom tooth, but there isn't a cavity in her head, not a single one. She has perfect teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the wisdom tooth will have to be pulled?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and it's very bad. It probably should be done at the hospital under general anesthesia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That would scare her to death. She's terrified of hospitals. To her, a hospital is where you go to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're right, it would be harder on her. But you'd better call Mr. Hillyer, she's going to need help to get home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY A shot of Daddy behind the wheel of the model-A. Rose lies pale and exhausted on Mother's shoulder on the front seat. A trace of bloody gauze can be seen in her mouth and her eyes are closed. Buddy is on the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a whisper, muffled by the bloody gauze) Never again, never again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with pity, gently) I know it was bad, honey. I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more dentists, no more dentists...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll get better now. EXT. HILLYER DRIVEWAY - DAY CUT TO a shot of the Model-A in the driveway of the Hillyer home. Mother helps Rose out of the car, but Rose can't stand on her feet. Daddy has to catch her from falling. Daddy picks her up in his arms and carries her up the steps as Buddy runs ahead to open the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HILLYER PATIO - DAY A shot of Mother and Daddy and Buddy on the patio. It is a beautiful sunny morning. Mother and Daddy are seated at an outdoor table about to have coffee. Daddy is opening mail and Buddy, in the b.g., is gluing up a kite. Enter a smiling and healthy Rose with orange juice, toast, cups and coffee on a tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Rose. And how do you feel today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonderful. Except I can touch the place back there with my tongue, I wouldn't even know I had that tooth pulled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dryly, as he looks at mail) Well, I know it, I just got the bill for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, for four or five days there I didn't think I'd live. But I'm my old self again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Umm. Well. Yes. But no more strange voices in the night, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose has learned her lesson, haven't you, Rose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HOTEL - MEZZANINE - DAY A shot of Daddy peering down at an old pool table in the mezzanine of the family hotel. Buddy stands by with a pool stick in hand. In the b.g., we see a black bellboy, SHADRACH, approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see my mother-in-law's face, son. Read 'em and weep, boy, I am playing a spectacular combination, a triple. The nine ball in the corner! (takes his stance with cue as Shadrach walks up) Read 'em and weep, boy, that's all she wrote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mistah Hillyer, the Chief of Police wants you on the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (about to make his shot, looks around) The Chief of Police?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yassuh. Daddy straightens up, sets his jaw, leans the cue against the table and marches toward the elevator as Buddy stares after him. The CAMERA STAYS on Buddy. INT. HOTEL - DAY CUT TO a shot of Buddy going down the hotel stairs. He holds onto the banister, sliding with his hands far ahead in order to take four and even five steps at a time -- it is a childish trick, the point of the game is to touch as few stairs as possible. ANOTHER ANGLE, on Buddy as he jumps down the last remaining five steps and walks into the lobby. Daddy comes from behind the desk, grim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose is in jail. She bit a policeman's thumb. Come on, son, Shadrach can run the hotel. EXT. MODEL-A - STREET - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy and Buddy in the Model-A. Daddy stares grimly ahead. Buddy steals a worried glance at him. INT. LOCAL JAIL - DAY CUT TO a shot in the local jail. The shot is on Daddy as he stands before jail bars staring sternly into a cell. His hands are on his hips, his straw hat is on the back of his head and a bit to one side. Buddy stands beside him, a little bit behind, a worried look on his face. The CHIEF OF POLICE, a fat man, is on the other side of Daddy. CUT TO a POV shot of Rose in the cell. Her hair is mussed, her dress is torn. A little innocent, frightened smile is on her face. The CAMERA PANS to include Daddy and the Chief of Police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a awful brawl down at the Busy Beaver, Mr. Hillyer. You know that fat Horton, the bootlegger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I know the son of a bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch is right, he dern near killed a man. And this girl was the cause of it all. What's more, she bit a police officer's thumb right to the bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Rose, what have you got to say for yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coughs, then feebly) I got an awful bad cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods slowly, then with aloof politeness) That's all you've got to say, you've got a bad cold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coughs again) Well, I don't know what happened. They were arguin' about baseball, then all of 'em started fightin'. As for that policeman, I didn't bite him, I don't think I bit him. In dour silence, Daddy and the Chief of Police stare at Rose. She gives them a little smile, as if to say, "See how innocent I am?" The Chief turns to Daddy and asks with dry irony:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she's your girl, Mr. Hillyer. You want me to release her in your custody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not really. But I guess we'll have to do that, John. Let her out. Let the crazy creature out and I'll take her home. INT./EXT. MODEL-A - DAY CUT TO a shot of Daddy, Rose and Buddy in the Model A. Daddy stares grimly ahead, silent. Buddy looks solemn. Rose is badly frightened and still coughing. Finally she ventures a little smile and speaks to Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got an awful cold, I think I'm sick. Daddy is silent, his eyes fixed ahead. EXT. HILLYER DRIVEWAY - DAY CUT TO a shot of the Model A as it turns onto the Hillyer driveway. INT./EXT. MODEL A CUT TO a shot of Daddy, Rose and Buddy in the car. She tries again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to bite him. He was hitting Horton with a blackjack in the meanest way and... and I bit him accidental.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stops the car, turns to Rose) I have to go back to the hotel. I'm on duty at the desk and who knows a quest might arrive. I will see you at suppertime, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a feeble smile) I didn't mean to bite him, I really didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will see you at suppertime, Rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (feebly) Yes, air. EXT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT STEPS - DAY CUT TO a shot of a shaky, slumped Rose going up the steps with Buddy as the Model A drives away. Rose is coughing, looks miserable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A SHOT of Buddy and Doll in the living room of the Hillyer home at night. Doll is half-heartedly practicing scales on the piano and Buddy is pacing the floor, hands clasped behind him in something like the style of his father. As the CAMERA FOLLOWS Buddy in his pacing we see Waski playing with marbles on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns around on piano stool, to Buddy) What is Rose going to do? Where can she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've been in there the longest kind of time. I can't stand it, I gotta find out what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better not snoop, Daddy'll kill you! INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy coming with great furtiveness from the living room out into the front hall. Very cautiously, he tiptoes across the hall and bows down and listens at the door of his mother's bedroom-study. He crouches down, peeps through the keyhole. INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM/STUDY - NIGHT CUT TO a "keyhole shot" of Daddy and Mother in the bedroom. Mother sits in her study chair, a handkerchief to her eyes. Daddy sits in a chair nearby. He looks depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, darlin', I hate it as much as you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wanly) Well, she does seem to cause a lot of trouble, I admit. But she doesn't mean any harm and it'll break the children's hearts, they all love her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's because of the children she's got to go. I don't want to be holier-than-thou, but the girl doesn't have the same outlook we do. Morals don't mean a thing to her, not a thing, and we can't have a girl like that in this house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is to say our morals are better than hers? (frowns, sighs) But maybe you're right. She could... influence Dolly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is exactly what I'm afraid of. (pauses, and firmly) The girl has got to go, darlin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But morals come from the heart, not from rigid rules and empty laws. And in her heart Rose has never hurt anyone and she never would. Therefore, she's not immoral. Not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now look, darlin', this is no time to go off into the fourth dimension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what I said is the simple truth. And now I see something else, I see more deeply into it... Mother has a slightly "other-worldly" look on her face. Daddy glances at the door of the bedroom, he suspects something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a moment, darlin'. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy crouched at the keyhole. With great alacrity, he jumps up and hurries across the hall and shuts the living room door just as Daddy whisks open the bedroom door. Daddy grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could of sworn that boy was out here. Daddy shuts the door and at once almost like the movement of a ballet Buddy opens the living room door and tiptoes back to the keyhole. INT. HILLYER HOME - MASTER BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a Shot of Daddy and Mother. It is another "keyhole shot."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could Rose really be a bad influence on Dolly? She has a loving nature, you ought to want someone like that around your children. Why do you think those boys and men like her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I have a pretty good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you mean sex, you couldn't be more wrong. Rose likes those boys and men, she has love in her heart, and that is what they want. It's the most rare and beautiful thing in life and that is why they follow her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They follow her because she's a -- (he is about to say "piece of tail," but interrupts himself)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: no, I won't say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What she doesn't understand is that her behavior is disturbing to other people. She's young, she's got to learn to restrain the life force that's in her. Its creative, but in her case it's too creative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darlin', Rose has got to go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rises) I'll talk to her, I'll reason with her. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy in the hall. He jumps up and hurries across the hall into the living room. Again, as the living room door shuts the bedroom door opens. Mother starts up the stairs, her mouth determined. INT. HILLYER HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Doll and Waski in the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother is struggling desperately. In fact she's fighting like a tiger. But I don't know, it's close, it's mighty close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pauses, then in a low tone, slightly wide-eyed) Buddy... does Rose really... "do it" with all those boys and men?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aloofly, like Daddy) Doll, don't ask childish questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indignantly, to Doll) Of course not!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Waski, you don't even know what we're talking about. INT. HILLYER HOME - UPSTAIRS HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Mother going down the upstairs hall. She knocks on Roses door and enters. INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Mother as she walks over and stares down in shock at Rose on the bad. Rose is lying back on a pillow and staring groggily at her, obviously not quite all there. Frowning with worry, Mother sits beside her and puts a hand on her forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, you're very sick. You're burning up. Rose, can you hear me? Rose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (semi-delirious) What? Wha-at? Mrs. Hillyer? EXT. HILLYER SOME - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of an ambulance pulling up outside the Hillyer house. Attendants get out of it carrying a stretcher. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT HALL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy, Doll and Waski in the front hall. They are badly frightened, even terrified. The CAMERA PANS to show the ambulance attendants carrying Rose strapped in a stretcher down the stairs, as Mother helps and Daddy follows, both of them very worried. Rose is conscious now and her eyes roll with terror toward the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buddy! Dolly! They're takin' me to the hospital! Don't let 'em, don't let 'em! The CAMERA STAYS on the frightened silent children as they stare after Rose on the stretcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - NIGHT A shot of Mother, Daddy, Buddy, Doll and Waski in the corridor of a hospital. All look very solemn. A nurse leads them to a door and opens it. INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of a hospital room. A very pale, sick-looking Rose lies in a hospital bed. The nurse, mother, Daddy, Buddy, Doll and Waski enter, all of them looking very grave. ANOTHER ANGLE, CLOSE ON Rose as she weakly turns her head on the pillow. Her eyes well with tears as she recognizes the children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a feeble whisper) Pray for me... ANOTHER ANGLE, on the nurse as she speaks in a whisper we don't hear to Mother and Daddy, obviously telling them they'd better go. Daddy beckons to the children and they start to leave, all looking depressed. INT. DOCTOR'S OFFICE - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of DR. F. ROBERT MARTINSON, a rather unpleasant man with a spade beard. He has a superior, patronizing way of talking and very little Southern accent if any. The scene is his office and he is in a swivel chair behind his desk. As he speaks the CAMERA PULLS BACK to show Daddy, Mother and the Hillyer children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mrs. Hillyer, the girl is strong as an ox and that is what is keeping her alive. But not many people walk away from double pneumonia, Madam, not many.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks terrible, just awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course she does and I must say I'm puzzled by your delay in getting her to the hospital. I should think ordinary powers of observation would have suggested to you that she was seriously ill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hid it from us, Doctor. She's afraid of the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a thin superior smile) Afraid of the hospital?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deathly afraid of it. Her people were poor tenant farmers and she doesn't know anything about doctors or medicine or hospitals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frowns in open disbelief) A tenant farm? Are you trying to tell me that girl is a product of the hookworm and pellagra belt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, her people were very poor. She says she was often hungry as a child, and I'm sure the food she ate was pretty awful, not a balanced diet at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly, and that's why she couldn't possibly have come from such a farm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (icily polite) Excuse me, sir, are you calling my wife a liar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (embarrassed) Honey, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a thin unpleasant smile) It's simply that I find it incredible, Mr. Hillyer. Aside from the girl's illness at the moment, she is very strong, a very healthy specimen of a young human female -- and a comely one, too. She must have gotten protein somewhere as a young child, if only sporadically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is kind of amazing. The dentist says she has perfect teeth, there isn't a cavity in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tries to make a supercilious joke) Her entire mouth is a cavity, Madam, ha ha ha.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dryly, doesn't like the man a bit) Ha ha ha ha. Mother frowns at Daddy and Dr. Martinson gives him an aloof glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with spurious dignity) The point is you don't grow up like that on a diet of sorghum and hominy grits. She got protein somewhere, she's a very strong girl and I think she'll live... despite the delay in medical treatment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all I want to know. (rises) Lets get out of here before I get the epizootics myself. Thank you, Doctor, for your discourse, it was fascinating, no doubt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, thank you, Doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as they leave) I beg your pardon, epi-zoo-tics? Do you mean "epi-zoo-ot-tics," an animal epidemic?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (icily polite, from the door) No, I mean epizootics. INT. HOSPITAL - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Mother, Daddy, Buddy, Doll and Waski as Daddy comes out of the Doctor's office and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't stand that polecat. They ought to hang him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like him because he's a Yankee. He's a brilliant doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a polecat, dear. INT. HOSPITAL ELEVATOR - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Daddy, Mother and the Hillyer children in a hospital elevator as a black elevator operator runs them down. Daddy has his hat politely removed and is staring pensively ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rosebud looked pretty pitiful in that bed. (sighs, shakes his head) I hope she'll be all right, but I still think we ought to fire her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see how you can even think of it now. Daddy purses his lips but says nothing. It is obvious the "epizootics" have saved Rose, at least for the time being.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT A SHOT of Rose in bed in her own bedroom. She is propped up on pillows and wearing a rather attractive pink silk housecoat of Mother's. A tray is on her lap and she is eating her supper as Buddy sits on the edge of the bed talking with her, or rather listening to her. It is obvious she is well on the road back to health.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he's so kind, so gentle inside, and so unhappy with that rich wife who doesn't understand him, her being a Southerner and everything, and what a bedside manner he has got -- so gentle and kind beneath the professor way he acts!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, you are too uncritical of people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know the bedside manner that man has got. Why, it does me good just to see him sit there all solemn and go pokin' in his bag like he's gonna cure me, which he did of course. And even more important he loves me, like a patient I mean, the other day he got tears in his eyes just listenin' to my heart beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he tried to hide it but I saw 'em, and a little bit he says to me, "You know, you are beautiful." Now wasn't that a nice thing for a doctor to say to a patient, wasn't it? What could cheer a girl up more?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, I have got doubts about that doctor and so does Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got doubts about hisself and that's the saddest thing of all. Would you believe that poor man thinks nobody likes him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'd believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I like him. I used to be afraid of doctors but not any more. Why, he could operate on me any old time and I wouldn't even be scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose, you are just entirely too uncritical of people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't neither. Listen here, Buddy, besides all his vast medical knowledge, he has the most kindest heart beneath the professor way he acts -- he wants justice in the world and he's got some real interestin' ideas. INT. HILLYER HOME - FRONT DOOR - NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Mother opening the front door. Dr. Martinson is there-with his black bag, an icy polite look on his face.;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, good evening, Doctor. Rose is a lot better, I just gave her her supper. She's almost all well now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me be the judge of that, Madam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Well. She's upstairs. INT. HILLYER HOME - ROSE'S BEDROOM - DAY/NIGHT CUT TO a shot of Buddy and Rose in Rose's bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice, that's what he wants, justice for everybody and especially for niggers.
